organizer.description:
Who We Are
Bring your own laptop training events works on a very simple concept. You bring your laptop and software, and we’ll conduct the training. Traditional training companies have to buy in expensive computers and software and then charge the high prices for training you to cover these costs. No Frills With Bring your own laptop training events you bring your own laptop and software and because we don’t have to pay for these then we can offer you our great training courses at very affordable prices. To keep prices down even further we don’t supply lunch, books or stationery. Just pure, fantastic training which will leave you inspired, happy and invigorated!
organizer.name: Bring Your Own Laptop

event.tags: indesign training courses, cs4, auckland, new zealand, bring your own laptop, short courses, adobe
event.title: InDesign CS4 Level 2 - Auckland - 100119

organizer.description: The Wildwood Dads Club is an all-volunteer, community based non-profit organization serving the Piedmont community and the Wildwood Elementary School since the 1920s. The WDC holds regular meetings on the 2nd Wednesday of each month from 7-8 PM in the Wildwood School teachers lounge. All Wildwood dads are welcome!
organizer.name: The Wildwood Dads Club

event.description:
Donation to HungerPlus, Inc.
"To reduce by half between 1990 and 2015 the proportion of people who suffer from hunger."
This goal, established by the 1996 World Food Summit, is being tested against improved measurements of food deficiencies and hunger worldwide. Hunger Plus, Inc. assists those who wish to join in the fight to reduce hunger and reach the World Food Summit goal by 2015. Current statistics indicate that the world is falling behind in achieving this worthwhile goal.
Problems of chronic and communicable diseases are becoming prevalent in many countries. Improper and insufficient diets contribute to these conditions and strain health services in many countries. Improved diets will reduce suffering and reduce pressure on health services.
Natural disasters (droughts, earthquakes, floods, etc.) are responsible for some of the world's hunger. These disasters can be addressed with the direct supply of food. The same is true of hunger resulting from conflicts. Chronic hunger must be addressed with more complicated long term solutions to break the cycle of poverty, malnutrition, and ultimately, hunger.
Hunger Plus, Inc. seeks to reduce suffering from hunger whether the cause is disaster, conflict, or chronic in nature.
event.title: Hunger Plus, Inc.
